review_blob:
High marks across the board except for flavor and overall - but not due to any real failing of the beer.  Its just not my cup of tea.  Too sweet/fruity for my taste.

Beautiful color, a great pour.  Lots of sediment.

Very nice head,  Slightly cloudy, but appealling golden colored.  Bright, refreshing aroma.  Appropriately bitter, but too much of a yeast finish - resulting in a "pucker" palate.  I assume this is due to the bottle conditioning and, thus, may vary by bottle (and yes, the bottle was poured correctly for a bottle conditioned beer.)

USA version:  Kinmount Willie Stout   Average.  Aroma - wispy yeast/cherry  Appearance -dark black with poor head  Flavor - thin malt to start, mild cherry middle, strong coffee finish through lingering  Palate - thin, distracting effervescence
